page.title: 14MEDICAL SERVICES ON SCORAIG
page.content: THERE IS A DISTRICT NURSE BASED AT BADCAUL WHO GIVES ALL SCHOOLCHILDREN INNOCULATIONS,WEIGHS NEW BORN BABIES, CHECKS IF THEY ARE ALL RIGHT.THE NEAR- EST DOCTOR IS AT ULLAPOOL AND PEOPLE GO TO HIS SURGERY IF NECESSARY.HE VISITS SCORAIG OCCASIONALLY.A SCORAIG WOMAN WHO WAS ONCE A NURSE NOW DEALS WITH EMERGENCIES SUCH AS BIRTHS AND ACCIDENTS. THE NEAREST HOSPITAL IS AT INVERNESS ABOUT 70 MILES AWAY.MOST PEOPLE GO THERE TO HAVE THEIR BABIES AND SOME GO FOR OTHER TREATMENTS.RAIGMORE HOSPITAL IS WELL EQUIPPED. ON ONE OCCASION AN EXPECTANT MOTHER WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL BY HELICOPTER AS IT WAS TOO STORMY TO CROSS THE LOCH BY BOAT.
